website_summaries.verdict: These smoky-flavored snacks are loaded with real deboned rabbit and other healthy ingredients to make you feel good about spoiling your dog.
pros: Made with nutritious ingredients, such as sweet potatoes and blueberries
cons: Bigger dogs may appreciate a larger treat

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Made In USA!
customer_reviews.text: I received my order a few days ago and immediately noticed the larger size. I was ok with that. What I wasn't ok with was the fact that, on the bag, it said "Safely USA Cooked With the World's Best Ingredients". It doesn't indicate where the ingredients are sourced. I will be returning these treats and looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs, all going through training. 3 of the 4 are allergic to beef, and they don't care for chicken products. I saw these and thought I'd give them a try. They LOVE them. I cut them in half for training, they aren't large, but since you use quite a bit when training and this breed tends to get fat, I wanted to make sure I wasn't giving them too much. I have set up a recurring subscription to these treats, that's how fond they are of them. Plus, it's less expensive here than at the local PetCo or PetSmart.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brou

customer_reviews.title: Great treats for training, with quality ingredients!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 month old (7 lb) dachshund puppy and I got these as the first treats to give him while potty training and crate training. I keep ordering these same ones because he loves them!! They are soft and I cut them in half since he is small and because I give them to him fairly often while training. I have no reason to look for other treats - I love these! I also feed him only organic puppy food and fresh fruit as his diet and health is very important to me, and I love that these have quality ingredients. Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: RETZ101

customer_reviews.title: Dogs tell me they taste great
customer_reviews.text: Merrick is my go to for all of the dogs snacks. When you open the bag you can smell the freshness of the ingredients and so can the dogs. They come running from all ends of the house. The individual pieces are small and moist making really good training treats for my larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: iPoutside365

customer_reviews.title: Great healthy turn it off for the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Great healthy turn it off for the dogs.Have ordered several items from the sprint and this is probably the third or fourth bag of snacks that we have ordered. Merrick does a great job with these. The ingredients are incredibly high quality, enter a huge favor for the pups. Both of the dogs seem to really enjoy the streets. Well true they are a little bit above average when it comes to price, they headed out of the park in terms of quality. I am OK paying a little more to get higher quality ingredients, and the streets certainly deliver.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy treat
customer_reviews.text: These Merrick Power Bites are the perfect size for training treats for my large & extra-large dogs. They're soft and small but they hold their shape in the treat bag and are easy to grab individually as a reward for a good "Heel!" or "Stay By Me!" or, well, any positive training phrase, really. You can treat liberally without stuffing the dog's stomach. The dogs love them and I feel good feeding a treat made with high quality ingredients such as real meat, no meal by-products or other garbage like artificial colors or preservatives. Especially like that they're made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Barbran

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These training bites are my pups favorite! They are soft enough you can break them in two pieces as well! She has not had any break outs since they are grain free!
customer_reviews.author: Dew townsend

customer_reviews.title: Both of my dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: I have one dog who has a beef intolerance and gets super sick from it, and a 9 month old puppy who's still being convinced to not behave like a heathen. These treats work great for both! Both of them love them, and we've placed them in the "high value" category as these have worked well to get our puppy's attention outside the house, which is tough sometimes. Its hard finding treats that our older dog can have since beef is in so much for dogs, and these fit the bill perfectly. They're larger than typical training treats though, so if you plan to use them for a lot of training I would recommend breaking them in half.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Izzy Approved! Merrick Power Bites are her favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving Merrick Grain Free Gluten Free Power Bites Dog Treats a five star rating, because the dog loves them like I love chocolate, LOL, and grain free treats are hard to find. I was hoping each treat was smaller, to use for training. Still, I can't complain about the quality. Izzy says they are her favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Zee5

customer_reviews.title: My dogs think these treats are the greatest. They are very small so I don't have ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs think these treats are the greatest. They are very small so I don't have to break them up which usually ends up as crumbs in my pockets. I like very small treats so my dogs don't get fat when I am training them. I use these treats both with my large dogs and small dogs. They have several flavors and the dogs love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Noseypaws

customer_reviews.title: Star-shaped bits for doggie all-stars
customer_reviews.text: Gummies for doggies. My pups love all the flavors of Power Bites. Not that rescue dogs are picky, but they show a special enthusiasm for these. The gummy texture is different than most dog treats. I can tell all the dogs love these and they look extra cute while chewing. The small size is great for rewarding good behavior and teaching tricks. Teaching them to catch these when tossed is a lot of fun. Made in the USA, I like to feel confident that these goodies are healthy and safe. I just shake the bag and they come running. Two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: MadMadeleine

customer_reviews.title: She loves them and we love that they are so small and tasty
customer_reviews.text: These are the ONLY treats my little 4 pound Yorkie will eat. Doesn't matter what flavor, but it has to be Merrick and has to be Power Bites. She loves them and we love that they are so small and tasty. They last a long time, and I don't feel like I'm wasting treats rewarding her for good behavior. These would be PERFECT for training any puppy. My dog can't get enough!! I love that it's such a healthy, reputable brand... highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small Treats for Incentives
customer_reviews.text: This product was attractive to my elderly dog when I first bought it, and was useful as an incentive treat. After about two weeks they became a bit on the hard side, which was difficult for her to chew and she rejected them. They have very good ingredients and the smell is not overly medicinal, but apparently not meaty enough for her. However, my dog is picky about consistency and freshness and she did like these up until her elderly-stages. I recommend these for most non-fussy dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Littlebip

customer_reviews.title: Dog seems to like the rabbit flavor, which is surprising
customer_reviews.text: Our dog seems to love these. We previously purchased on a whim through another online store, so I purchased again when he seemed to like them. I was honestly skeptical these are rabbit and the first time he tried them he kind of acted like he didn't like the taste, but now he eats them right up. I've yet to try any of the other flavors with our dog.
customer_reviews.author: JLovesBooks

customer_reviews.title: My dog's new favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! It may be because she hasn't ever had rabbit-flavored treats before, but she would probably die for these. They're nice and small for training, and they're super soft. The bag is plenty full so you're really getting your moneys worth. The only thing about these treats is that they are REALLY scented, which is probably a reason why my pup loves these so much. They leave rabbit smell behind on your hands. I just make sure I wash my hands after handling them, and that I keep the bag zipped shut!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pup Approved
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these treats and they are the perfect training aid size. In fact for puppy training I was able to cut them up to get more bang for my buck.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs has some food sensitivities and I avoid chicken and beef for their staple items. It's in almost everything, but not in the rabbit flavor power bites. And my dogs love these so much. I preferred the smaller version, they were a better size for training, but when they increased the size u just started breaking them in half and it's similar.
customer_reviews.author: Talya

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Already Opened
customer_reviews.text: I received this about 2 days ago, and since I don't currently have my dog, the package sat on my coffee table. Last night, I was looking at it and realized that the packaging was already opened at the top! It's as if the seal didn't close correctly when manufactured, or the bag has been mistreated or is just old. Either way, having used these before I know they CAN be very good treats, however, when the bag arrives already open, the Freshness rating will not be good! I would love if the seller would send me a new bag; preferably one that is still sealed shut.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I keep seeing other reviewers complaining that the product changed and the morsels are bigger than the original - but I have a 70lb American Pitbull and the size of this new treat is PERFECT. If you have a small dog (anything under 40lbs) I will say these may be too big as training treats, but if you have a larger breed then these fit the bill and our dog loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham V.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't agree with my dogs stomachs
customer_reviews.text: My 3 pups were very excited to try these. They seemed fresh, and tasty to our dogs. We like the small size and used these is preference to the larger treats for our pups. Our dogs get Merricks Salmon Little plates as their kibble. However, after getting a treat, one of my dogs had a soft stool he couldn't hold in on my carpet. Later that day, the girl pup threw up within minutes of having a treat. Since that was the only thing new in their diet, we threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Oh bother

customer_reviews.title: My Dachsund LOVES them!
customer_reviews.text: This is a new product for my dog and he gets excited when he smells them. He is now 14 (people) years old and does not get too excited nowadays. He goes after these. He has a sensitive stomach but since they are salmon he should be okay. I will update this if I think these are upsetting his stomach. I used to buy a Merrick salmon jerky for him which he loved but it must be discontinued because I have been unable to find it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving Name, not BIG bit s
customer_reviews.text: Andre the German Shepherd, 100+lbs approves of the taste . His companion person doesn't like the misleading package. It says "Power Bites, Big Bites. They are quarter-sized & chewy. Not big. I confess they contain natural protein, Omega 6 fatty acids .5%, glucosamine 450 mg /kg, L-Chondroitia sulfate 400mg/kg, L-Carnitine225mg/kg. Of course his regular med contains much more product & is exclusive for dog hips Too expensive for what we have -a tiny treat , won't order again
customer_reviews.author: AndreStefan

customer_reviews.title: Size of bites are now twice as big (as of spring 2018)! Same wonderful formula :)
customer_reviews.text: Merrick did change the size of these in spring 2018 - each treat is now almost double its size (for those of you having to measure daily calories for your dog) so I now break these in half to serve as before. Still a huge favorite with my miniature schnauzer who suffers with chicken additive allergies in her food - she does wonderfully with all Merrick products which eliminate gluten/poultry (except where used as flavor) and grains.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn FTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: but it ended up extremely useful since I just rescued a stray shepherd and she ...
customer_reviews.text: So I totally ordered these not realizing they were tiny little morsels... but it ended up extremely useful since I just rescued a stray shepherd and she needs a bit of training. I already have a 90lb shepherd that would laugh at these, but the new pup finds them irresistible. Shes food aggressive so I feed her one by one. It forces her to be gentle and slow. I would highly recommend these for training.
customer_reviews.author: PMR

customer_reviews.title: Smells great, and (according to Thor) tastes great too
customer_reviews.text: Smells great, and (according to Thor) tastes great too! Whenever he feels the smell of them he will run to me for a treat! I haven't seen any bad side effects (Thor gets gassy with some treats) and the fact that they are tiny helps as you can use them for training without being worried about feeding your dog too many
customer_reviews.author: Mary Pury

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: My lab is a rescue and by no means picky when it comes to food. These are the first treats that I have noticed some kind of extra enthusiasm for. When I first opened the package, my fiancé commented "oh that smells nice, is that jerky," she thought it was human food based on the smell. While I can use his kibble as training treats around the house, I use these outside or in other distracting environments because they are clearly higher reward for him. For instance, when we began working with him outside more his kibble really didn't interest him, but he comes running for these.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Ager

customer_reviews.title: Great training treats
customer_reviews.text: My pup will do most anything for these high value dog treats. The smell makes him willing to work, and the size is great for jackpot treats. I do cut them up to get the most bang for my money during training.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: Quality treats that my dogs LOVE
customer_reviews.text: It can be hard to find treats that really get dogs excited. Our dogs love these and look forward to training. They run over every time they hear a bag open (even if it isnʻt their treat bag). The bag is kind of small, but you can break up the treats if you prefer (which we did). I'd buy a bigger bag if you are just starting to train your puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleonahe

customer_reviews.title: Merrick "treats' our dog right!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent treats - they work great with training our "food motivated" puppy. These treats are Made in the USA - that is comforting in today's day and age. Henry has thrived on Merrick dry puppy food - and these treats do not disappoint. We were using Zuke's treats (that the pup liked as well) but we solved the loose stool mystery once we switched to the Merrick Power Bites. Quality Treat - no corn, no soy, no wheat. Quality Company, Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: Research Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed- these used to be “soft” treats, the last two bags I have bought are so hard. I don’t know if it’s because of how they are stored in the warehouse but my little dog can barely chew them. I won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: CDS

customer_reviews.title: Big Difference in dogs energy levels
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed a visible difference in my dogs energy after switching them to Merrick food/treats. Also less stomach upset. I have always fed them Science Diet, which is a great dog food as well, but unfortunately with some fillers. I read that the Jack Russell breed should not have fillers in their food so I switched them to Merrick. I am 100% satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Sparklers

customer_reviews.title: Greay Quality Merrick Treat
customer_reviews.text: I think they must be good because our dog will do just about any trick or command to get one. I like that they aren't greasy and mushy like some other training treats. They are soft but not too soft. They don't have some gross smell either. I added it to my subscription to receive every other month.
customer_reviews.author: M. Webb

customer_reviews.title: My dog refuses to eat any
customer_reviews.text: My dog refuses to eat these, even if he’s hungry. I bought the beef, and salmon also. I expected each bag to be a different color like salmon should be orangish. Each treat bag of different treats are the same shape and exact same color. Had high hopes for these as they are highly regarded for their purity and quality. And my dog is not a picky eater.
customer_reviews.author: EveS

customer_reviews.title: yum!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these! They are great for training because they have a strong smell and they get the dogs attention. He knows when he's getting them! And the other dogs in his training class love them too!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol of Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Beef
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love them. Only “bad” thing is they’re a little big. These would be great for a German Shepard or something similar. I have Boston terriers, and like to give treats often for good behavior. And these are a little too big for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: My 7 dogs love these treats
customer_reviews.text: I use these as puppy training treats but also give to my older dogs. I love the fun shapes and the ingredients. I have 7 dogs from some 10 pounders to 3 over 100 pounds and everyone loves these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Cook

customer_reviews.title: My sweet baby girl loves them
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old sweet girl looooves these. She can be a little bit of a picky eater so I know these must be good. Also, because she's a 5lb chihuahua she can't eat treats that are too big. These are just the perfect size & texture for her. Last but not least, they seem to stay pretty fresh, unlike other treats that seem to go hard rather fast.
customer_reviews.author: Lizette P

customer_reviews.title: Tasty treats!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these, and I like the fact they are made in the USA and with whole ingredients. If I'm going to give a treat, I want a good quality treat, and this is it. He LOVES them! They're not too big, so will fit in a treat dispensing toy, which keeps him happily busy for 10-15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: CactusMomma

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes them
customer_reviews.text: These were a little pricey but our newly adopted rescue pup really liked them and they worked well for training. We figured out afterwards that he's just as motivated by getting his dried dog food and mostly just do that now, but I'll be ordering more of these for those training sessions where I want him to really, really want them to work on harder training.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Many

customer_reviews.title: Dessert Please!
customer_reviews.text: So weird they ask for a flavor rating... I haven’t tried them, my dog eats them... not really a 1-5 rating kind of data lol These are the perfect size for a small dog. Smell good, moist, soft and a hit in this house! FYI, she’s a 9yr old Yorkie under 10lbs
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves These Treats
customer_reviews.text: My small dog is very particular with his treats, and he is always happy to see these coming. I look for pure ingredients always. I do cut them into 4 pieces to better accommodate my dog's preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Gold

customer_reviews.title: My poor baby
customer_reviews.text: Made my puppy so sick I first thought I was the runs cause I woke up to it then found out she was puking before the treats she was perfectly normal
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Bag arrived open and treats were hard as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately when I received the item it had been opened already. The bag had two closures one that was supposed to be cut open then one underneath that “zipped” open and closed. The bag I received was open and product spilled in the box. The package says they are soft and chewy but they were hard as a rock. My small dog could not eat it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them. Package is difficult to get open
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love all of these treats. But the package is a real pain in the butt to try to open! After you tear the top flap off, the two sides of the top are even and very hard to separate to get the bag open. My dogs get annoyed waiting for me to get the bag open. Gotta be a better design
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: Great brand
customer_reviews.text: Well since I cannot tell you how this product tastes (lol) I can tell you that I've purchased Merrick canned dog food and treats multiple times and I'm never disappointed. My dog is always happy and we've never had any problems with the quality and as far as I know there haven't been any recalls either.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Navarro

customer_reviews.title: My dog definitely enjoyed these
customer_reviews.text: So as you can see my dog definitely loved these lol I put these on top on night stand and mind you my dog never comes in my room And knows not to . She has never chews shoes or has gotten into food before and SHE ATE THE WHOLE BAG LOL . She is extremely picky with food . So I was really happy to see that she definitely enjoyed this haha
customer_reviews.author: Cason1967

customer_reviews.title: Fairly soft, dogs have not complained.
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between getting the large size or the small size, but I went with the large. Fortunately, the treats are fairly soft and easy to break a small chunk off (for my little terrier mix) and give the rest to my big dog (great dane) effectively making them about the size of training treats for each.
customer_reviews.author: The Dutch Touch

customer_reviews.title: My 2 dogs love these merrick power bites
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs love these Merrick power bites! They are healthy, no grains, and they are soft and chewy! The little dog is a picky eater, but he really likes these Merrick power bites! They're soft and chewy, they don't crumble (which is a good thing!). My 14 year old lab loves these treats also, soft and chewy and easy for her to chew at her age!! Since they like these Merrick power bites so much, I have already ordered more! 5 out of 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: KoTToN

customer_reviews.title: My 2 girls would not even touch this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 bags of the rabbit and sweet potato treats because of all the rave reviews. But my 2 Shih Tzu's will not even touch this stuff. I've tried offering it to them everyday for a week, and they just smell it and walk away. No interest what so ever. 2 paws down for us.
customer_reviews.author: G. Luke

customer_reviews.title: NOT the item shown in the picture
customer_reviews.text: I even asked if these are the small or medium size. The picture shows small size. But I received medium sized, which are too big to use as training treats. So I have a choice - either go to the pain of returning them (shipping, waiting for a refund, etc.) or spend time cutting each one up into 3 or 4 pieces. You can see an accurate picture of what you get if you look for the ones labeled "medium."
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A M

customer_reviews.title: Great training dog treat, but a little big
customer_reviews.text: My minature golden loves these treats! It's great for training. But like other reviews had mentioned. They made the size bigger. So now I spend some time to cut them up into 5 pieces. It's worth it for what you pay for. Because my dog can go through 20 pieces just in learning repetitive commands. I recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: LDUBS

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss with my dogs....
customer_reviews.text: I did not order because they are grain free as that is not what I feed my dogs or condone, I got these more or less for the pricing. They arrived kind of dried up which wasn't great. My dogs ate them but after gnawing on them a bit because they were a little hardened. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Aimcat

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES these treats!
customer_reviews.text: I have a sweet dog with severe allergies so I have to be very careful what I feed her, even toys and treats. There are very few treats I can give her but I have been able to safely to reward her with these with confidence. She is crazy about them and I have the a great way to reward her without her getting sick.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneL

customer_reviews.title: Great treats. Disappointing new size.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these regularly for my small dog over the last year or so. He's a rescue and has some reactivity problems, so these used to be a perfect size for reinforcement training to bring on walks. I just received a new bag and the treats are double in size. I am disappointed that this wasn't advertised more clearly. My dog loves them so I would definitely recommend them as regular treats, but unfortunately they no longer fit my needs, so I won't be buying them, at least not as frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: We have dogs and foster puppies and these treats are great. They are a more Sunday's size than other training treats, so not the best choice if you plan to work repetitively with tricks/treats, but great for a couple times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not a strong scent!! Healthy treat!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! They are a must in my treat cupboard!! When I ordered them I expected them to be softer, but my dog could chew them easily. They smell slightly fruity, the scent isn’t strong enough for a good distraction mechanism. For an everyday treat they’re healthy enough to make it into her daily treat mix.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn’t eat these
customer_reviews.text: This is the first thing I’ve ever tried to give my dog that he didn’t like. He not only snarled up his nose but actually shook his head in disgust. He wouldn’t come near me as long as I held it. He’s an American Bulldog and he even likes pickles! I guess this is a no go for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Lemke

customer_reviews.title: My McDreamy approved
customer_reviews.text: My McDreamy is a fawn coloured deer-legged Chihuahua and most know that Chihuahuas can be rather finicky. He def enjoys these. Plus, I love the fact that they are healthily made and concocted here within these United States. I would def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy Stone

customer_reviews.title: BEST for training
customer_reviews.text: My puppy will do just about anything for one of these .. the smell is STRONG !! and she LOVES that .. these are the BEST for training, Sadie will not take her eyes off of me while she is in training and these wonderful smelly treats are in my pocket !
customer_reviews.author: cynthia papasian

customer_reviews.title: Easy on my dog's sensitive stomach
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs gets an upset digestive system if he has chicken, beef, or dairy. So it's good to find something that he can stomach. I've found several things that work, but what I really like about this treat is that it doesn't make my hand as nasty as most of the other treats that work for my dog. It's also easy to throw, so if you like to send your dog off to search for it, these are ideal for that too.
customer_reviews.author: April Shamel

customer_reviews.title: Happy Frenchies!
customer_reviews.text: I thought my 2 frenchies were eating too much beef and chicken and thought I would put them on fish. Hesitant at first but actually demolished these bites and asking for more. A true winner
customer_reviews.author: Keri Haines

customer_reviews.title: Best dog treats on the market
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these and settle for nothing less. Great for dogs with allergies like mine that have limited ingredients they can eat. Healthy in moderation of course. Would recommend them to all dog parents.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than anticipated but still liked by my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit big for small dog training treats which was my initial reason for the purchase, but my dogs enjoy them. They’re soft enough to break in half so they work. Nice size pack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kendra

customer_reviews.title: Finicky dog likes these!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is finicky, but she like this treat. They seem so fresh. Actually, my granddaughter tries to eat them when I let her give a treat to dog. I don’t let her, but they must be good cause she keeps trying!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Tudor

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package my two dogs jumped up and licked their mouths. They got one piece just to show how they liked it, and after that they had to obey my direction to get any more. They did. It is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Little Bird

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Delicious!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are both of my dogs favorites. These are the only treats my dog Yogi will stop in her tracks, and instantly behave for.... lol. It’s a negative that they’re not available for monthly subscriptions:(
customer_reviews.author: Fame

customer_reviews.title: Tail-Wagging Good!
customer_reviews.text: Ha! I click five stars and Amazon tells me it means "I love it!" but truth be told, it's my dog who loves it :) And oh boy, does she ever. She is absolutely mad for the Turducken. They make great training treats, and I don't feel bad about feeding her a number of them, as they're low in calorie, a concern because extra weight could put unnecessary weight on her hips, and I don't want to do that. Anyhow, while she can't speak human words, she does indeed tell me she loves these in all the ways a dog can :)
customer_reviews.author: lilcreative

customer_reviews.title: Perfect soft bite size treat
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love them. HeAlthy and practically odor free great alternative dog treat to chicken which my dog is allergic too. They hear the sound of the package opening and they come running ....definitely buying again
customer_reviews.author: WZ

customer_reviews.title: My Pups Loved Them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these treats since i got puppies that needed training. The pups loved them instantly and started listening right away! Only reason its not 5 stars is because there weren't many. Would still recommend these for training treats or treats in general.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: At first the dogs were not into it but they are better now. They are more than happy to take the treat and I like the ingredients. Theses are a great training size. They fit in training pouch well.
customer_reviews.author: paisley

customer_reviews.title: Must taste terrible - doggy says “no way”
customer_reviews.text: My American Bulldog is not very finicky. He just walk away from these without a look. Too bad because I wanted to boost his protein diet. Stick with Rachel Ray treats. He’s never tuned them down and they are by far his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: JBUICE

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite treats
customer_reviews.text: The Merrick power bites are my dog's obsession. Especially the salmon. They are the perfect size and consistency for a small breed and don't smell bad for us fur parents! These are a go to in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good scent and freshness
customer_reviews.text: Great scent and freshness. Rather large for a small dog as training treats. I had to cut them into tiny bits and then they crumble a little. Otherwise my dog likes them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Susan k

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't interested!
customer_reviews.text: Dog didn't want them at first and seemed to eat them later on but wasn't still too interested In them. I ordered different treats (core narrow treats) and now she goes crazy for them that she seeks the bag out everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Nutritious Treat
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats. They’re not to hard, just the right texture.
customer_reviews.author: AnnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A name you can trusr
customer_reviews.text: Mabel approved. Our 45lb hound/Shepard puppy loves these. They are a great size for breaking up as training treats too. We love Merrick grain-free products for our puppy & cat
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Good Training treat
customer_reviews.text: I buy treats with ingredients and size as number one things to look for. These are a good small treat with good ingredients. I went back and got two more bags because our labradoodle loves these best.
customer_reviews.author: JANA

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat for Training or Snacking!
customer_reviews.text: My pup really loves these treats! I like them because the star shape allows me to easily break them into small bits for training purposes. Make sure to seal the bag well, or they will dry out and harden quickly. Overnight it even makes a big difference, but when I sealed it up tight again the softness returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tehryn & Alex VanSickle

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these unless your dog will eat anything
customer_reviews.text: I am a dog walker and only one dog out of about 50 like them. That particular dog won't eat anything including poop.b I gave them to the owner of that dog because nobody would eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Toonces

customer_reviews.title: Great soft treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys them. She has a sensitive stomach so we try to stick to some of the more natural softer treats. They are soft small bites. We usually rotate between a few of the flavors to keep some variety in her life.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect incentive treat and great price
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves all the flavors of these! They are a great incentive treat, perfect size. And it’s cheaper than buying them at petco Will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Came hard with a hole in the bag
customer_reviews.text: My dog usually loves these treats when purchased at the store, they're moist and super fragrant. He wouldn't go near these. The bag seemed to have a hole in it somewhere because air would escape when squeezed while sealed. The treats were hard and stale, not soft and crumbly as intended. Its disappointing because usually he goes crazy for these and I was hoping to avoid having to go to a store during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Costa-Giomi

customer_reviews.title: My big dog LOVES Merrick Power Bites
customer_reviews.text: Merrick Power Bites are of high quality and, according to my dog, taste very good. My large American Staffordshire Terrier will do anything for these treats. They are a great reward for good behavior as well as an excellent training aid. These Power Bites are the only treats I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size for training.
customer_reviews.text: These are a good size for our puppy and we use them for a training treat. They smell pretty good actually, and pup likes them! They're pretty small, so they work well for our training sessions, and the soft texture means they are easy to eat. I'd buy them again, but looking over the ingredients they look to have added sugar (brown sugar and molasses), so I might search out something a bit healthier next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rico Suave

customer_reviews.title: My Yorkie loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I got one of each flavor from this company for my Yorkie puppy as training treats. His absolute favorite is the Salmon and the Red Meat mix. He is on a raw diet and these are nice for quick grab and go for the park or walks.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Tasty good reward treats for my spaniel
customer_reviews.text: My spaniel thinks they are great and Special tasty treats. I use them as a reward for good behavior -- one or two here and there through the day :) (I also give some tinier treats or kibble bits when training my dog so not to overdo the calories)
customer_reviews.author: VICKY

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves the chewiness of these treats. She looks forward to them daily. Being she is a Terwhawha, a small breed type dog, she knows her stuff or taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these treats!  Small and perfect for training when you give quite a few in a short period of time.
customer_reviews.text: I feed the Merrick brand good, really I feel it's the best out there, so when looking for small soft treats for training, these seemed the obvious choice. Two of my dogs LOVE this Salmon flavor best, the other dog really didn't like it, but likes the Turducken well. These treats are quite small, yet soft enough I can still break them in half if I want to, without a mess. I'd HIGHLY recommend these for training!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Rancher's Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great treats for sensitive tummy’s
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats! Great for training because they’re small, and haven’t upset her sensitive tummy. I highly recommend this brand in general
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My girl loves them!
customer_reviews.text: These are larger than I expected ... I use them for treats when I take my dog on a hike. I just misread the listing, they are fine and I cut them into 4's before a hike ... fit great in my pocket and are incentive for my pup to come back when called.
customer_reviews.author: Francis.

customer_reviews.title: Our Boston loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our picky Boston lives these treats. She is on a special diet so we have to feed her rabit. She would do tons of tricks for a small piece of these treats :)
customer_reviews.author: A.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats and the price on here is better than buying in the store! I’ve always loved Merrick too. I can’t comment on the flavor, but if my dog could talk I’m sure he would say they’re delicious the way he eats them!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Puppy love!
customer_reviews.text: Our new puppy loves these. She begs for them anytime she hears me pickup the bag. They smell great, like beef jerkey.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Training Treat when Broken into Smaller Pieces
customer_reviews.text: As-is, these treats are pretty large to use as training treats for our 45lb staffy mix. However, they can easily be broken into 3-5 pieces per treat that are the perfect size! Worth the tiny bit of extra effort, as these are a great price for such great ingredients, and I love that I can switch up the flavors to keep our pup on her toes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Treats
customer_reviews.text: They are tiny, but my husky loves these things. I just give her several at a time. They are probably most useful as a training treat due to their small size, and they assist us when it's time to brush/de-fur our furball!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Hard and dry
customer_reviews.text: They were very dry which made them hard. Very difficult for a puppy to chew so I ended up throwing them out. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: irene

customer_reviews.title: Very fresh, dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes them. I cut them in half and put them in a pineapple toy that releases treats when you roll it around and she enjoys that. They were very fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Loved By My Pupperchino
customer_reviews.text: My 55lb dog loves these. Some training treats can be a quick swallow for her, but these are larger and she actually chews them. Moist. Loved by my pupperchino!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Beagle approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our beagle puppies are working on their rabbit hunting skills, so I thought a rabbit meat treat would be extra incentive. It is flavored with smoke flavor, so I'm not sure how much rabbit meat flavor is really coming through, but the dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great treas
customer_reviews.text: My daughter’s dogs only eat Merrick brand foods. Also they can’t have chicken. Amazon has one of the best selections of this brand
customer_reviews.author: M. Rochelle

product_meta.title: Merrick Power Bites All Natural Grain Free Gluten Free Soft & Chewy Chews Dog Treats
product_meta.description: Style:Power Bites| Flavor Name:Rabbit| Size:6 oz. PouchMerrick Power Bites are soft and chewy all-natural treats, with big taste and industry-leading levels of powerful protein packed into every bite. These small star-shaped treats are perfect for training and rewarding dogs. Grain free and gluten-free, Merrick Power Bites start with real deboned meat, fish or poultry as the #1 ingredient plus fresh fruits and vegetables.
feature_bullets: #1 ingredient is real deboned rabbit jerky chips
Grain-free and gluten-free, without sorbic acid
Soft and chewy all-natural treat for great for training or rewards
Poultry-free recipe for dogs with sensitivities to poultry ingredients

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
